Reviews.Title: “We felt really well looked after”
Reviews.Author: razzybintheplacetobe
Reviews.Content: Location is good to get to from M1 although right on the busy Hendon Way. Check in was 3pm but we got there early at 12 ish. We were told they may have the room ready a bit earlier and we were asked to wait. The staff brought us cups of tea and we relaxed in the nice surroundings. The room was ready early. The room was lovely- spacious and really nicely decorated. Shower was excellent. I was running at Hamstead Heath and it turned out to be a nice walk to get there. Hamstead and Hamstead Heath are lovely places to visit and we never ventured closer to the centre. If you want to get to central London you could get the bus from outside the Hotel, although may take a while. Road noise wasnt as bad as we thought in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: DELBOYHULL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with my 2 sons we found the room very clean ,tidy and very quiet but is some way from the train stations and the west end ,there is a bus service 113 from the hotel into the west end 'The hotel is on a very busy highway,as is not near any shops or pubs ,so if you like a drink you will have a good walk,but for the price you pay its good value.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STANDARDS FOR LONDON”
Reviews.Author: BrianfromKingsbury
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find a good hotel in London for a sensible price; some of those near to the main railway stations are dreadful. The Best Western Palm is ideal although it is a twenty minute walk from Golders Green underground station which is the way I go to the hotel which I have used four times. The rooms are large and the furniture modern. There is good service at reception. Breakfast is very good with a mixture of buffet and waiter served English breakfast. Right outside the hotel there is a bus stop with buses going to Central London. The hotel is on Hendon Way and bedrooms facing the road are obviously more noisy than those facing to the rear. However the windows are double glazed and this makes the rooms at the front quite acceptable. There are a few places to shop and eat plus a pub within easy walking distance of the hotel. Walk in a southerley direction and cross Hendon Way via the pedestrian bridge. The hotel said they will be getting wi-fi but meanwhile there are network cables in each room which will plug into your laptop. This gives internet access and is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “A suprisingly nice suburban hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellapad
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews on this website marked the hotel as average and issues with rennovations being noisy, so i was a bit hesitant but thought surely they won’t be making noise at night so all I need is a good sleep. Upon our arrival, we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel seemed to look completely refurbished with only the exterior still being updated. The rooms were small (average by budget London hotel standards), however they provided a clean and compact solution to our living dilemma. Double bed, big plasma tv, a work desk with free internet and a great little window with auto blinds makes you feel like you are in a cozy little top floor studio apartment. The breakfast was a sore point for some previous travellers and while by no means is it a luscious spread, they do cook an English breakfast on demand, which was a great option. Fresher and more personalized than a buffet breakfast . To be honest I was surprised that a room rate as cheap as ours included a breakfast. A careful comparison of other last minute London hotels only provided us with a disgusting selection of bed bug ridden and poor quality establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: lufc0511
Reviews.Content: This is about my fourth stay here, Each time its improving, The staff are friendly especially the Restaurent staff which was an area I had concerns about in my last review, The simple touch of a menu for breakfast on the table makes a difference and people used it (complaint for the lack of this last time) Well Done, The Hotel is airy with modern decor and rooms are modern, Comfortable and as long as you have a rear room its peaceful, (Traffic Noise in the front) The Meals are of reasonable quality, But the steak was still pink in the middle for a "Well Done" request. I stayed Mon 21st Nov to Fri 25th Nov a couple of functions took place but it wasn't heard in the Bedrooms, Its "Worth a Visit" if in the Golders, Cricklewood, West Hampstesd area Handy for A41, A406, M1 a little more expensive than some for the area, But appealling

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Best Western were excellent. Clean and well appointed with an excellent walk-in shower. However the service in the restaurant in the evening was truly appalling. We were given menus and expected to order instantly with the waitress looking surprised when we asked for some time. The starters were ok. My main course and one of my colleagues were pleasant enough but my other colleague had to wait another 20 minutes before he risotto arrived and when it did it looked like slop and tasted little better. It was also warm on one side but cold on the other. The waitress also took away the two ended plates whilst my other colleague was still eating. We then had to wait 45 minutes for desserts. However we got off lightly as other people in the restaurant at the same time had to wait upwards of 2 hours for burgers and chips! Some got so fed up that they gave up and went to bed whilst another stormed into the kitchen to cancel their order. There was little attempt to apologise or rectify the situation by the serving staff and the whole matter was treated with indifference bordering upon contempt. The only apolgy received was from the reception staff upon complaining when checking out in the morning. I'd recommend that anyone staying at the Best Western Palm Hotel makes arrangements to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Kylie P
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, a few staff were excellent & very helpful. Some were not, speaking in perhaps Russion or some other language between themselves which I found very rude considering we were in an English speaking country. Some staff unable to provide any assistance at all. Housekeeping was not good, sheets were changed once in 5 days & had to request towels and milk. Breakfast is a rip of at Â£15, scrambled eggs are uneatable. There is no room service and food is not a available most days instead offering you a take away menu from a pizza shop. One poor girl working in the dinning room was yelled at in a foreign language by a co-worker while we were having breakfast, very uncomfortable atmosphere. If there is any type of function you will be told to park in the street as they need the parking spaces at the hotel for function guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Palms ?”
Reviews.Author: Ian_HBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on several occassions between June 2011 and October 2011. I was joined by a number of other delegates who also stayed at the hotel on the same dates. We were booked in by our company so had to endure it until the end. First things first, you don't want a room at the front of the hotel unless you normally sleep by a motorway. The main A41 dual carriageway runs within 5 metres of the front of the hotel. The best rooms are at the back of the hotel second floor, these are in high demand and those who give the hotel high scores probably stayed in those rooms !. The service is quite poor, requests generally get ignored they never passed on from one shift to another. The airconditioning might work - maybe it won't. The electrical boxes in each room "buzz" when powered up, this has something to do with the energy saver in the fusebox, it will drive you mad. You cannot open the windows - "handles removed for safety reasons". These problems reported by many colleagues, so not just the room I had. The hotel is very popular with school parties from UK and abroad, so be prepared for the adolescent to & fro-ing. The breakfast is passable , but dear or dear, don't try the dinner. It was consistently bad over several stays, soggy pastry, rubbery vegetables and about 7 things on the menu - thats it. Sweet was just as bad - lemon sponge, but any cream ?......ur "no", chef doesn't have any............Basil, Basil, Basil.........coming Sybil.......(BBC Fawlty Towers), stay here if you want to experience the worst Best Western Hotel, I gotta say they were consistent (just darn awful).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: royferg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 15th 16th 17th September, Room was large as it was at the end of the block,but the ceiling came down from a point and i banged my head a few times when i went to get something from my case which i left in this area and forgot about the slope. The staff were very friendly at reception and booked use Taxi's with a smile. Hairdryer in the room was in desk drawer there was no mirror so wife didnt like that at all, tea making was in the pointy bit,wrong place more banging of head. Shower was not powerfull and although you could remove it from its fixing when you put it back it pointed straight at the sink and as ther was no curtain place got a bit wet. Bed was not very comfortable i have stead in other best western hotels and the beds were brilliant. Breakfast was a Rip Off at Â£15 dont bother with it. I stead here before it got taken over and it was a nice Hotel and not expensive it cost me Â£269 room only for the 3 nights. If you have a car its fine but each time we went to Golders Green it was Â£5 Â£6 Â£7 or Â£8 depending on how much the Taxi Driver wanted to rip you off. There were also private Partys on both fri and sat nights so you couldnt use the bar,if you wanted a drink you had to sit in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms shame about the service...”
Reviews.Author: Karenpoynton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is going through a face lift which is giving it a slick modern feel that brings it up to date. The BIG down side of this hotel is the service, breakfast is a nightmare, no evidence that cooked breakfast is available, lucky if asked, tables not set. All cereal, toaster, coffee etc is on one little table meaning times it was impossible to get to for people waiting for toast etc. Evening meals, are poor quality and appeared microwaved and service was poor. On checkout I was asked to pay for my evening meal,this was included in my company allowance, staff need to take care to read information (same happened in Corby Best Western)

Reviews.Title: “Getting There”
Reviews.Author: lufc0511
Reviews.Content: Stayed One night, Reception staff friendly and welcoming, Fast check in, and lovely room, The Hotel is presently going under some refurb (No problem) Modern bathroom (Shower no Bath) Some Road noise at the front of the hotel, but bearable, Comfortable Bed & pillows, I had food in the evening and requested "Well Done" steak this came medium reasonable price, Breakfast No Menu for the full english, But only requested scrambled egg on toast with slice of bacon, No toast arrived and told to make my own on the toaster, The scrambled egg was uneatable, WILL USE AGAIN but I will be watching the food, The atmosphere in the dining room was cold and unwelcoming, But it seems like early days for the team. Will be there again end of Sept

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: SammieJ0
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel outside of my usual area due to lack of availability in the city - but I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. The room was a great size, comfortable, contemporary decor and nice modern bathroom.I was in an upstairs room, and didn't hear any disturbance although I heard others compaining of a noisy room. Its worth asking for a quiet room I think! (Its located on a busy main road). I had room service dinner - service was good and food was excellent and really good value too. Overall this is a good find in London and represents value for money. Short taxi ride from the tube, but was easy to travel back to my work location.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: nps01
Reviews.Content: Fair location due to public transport links. The rooms have been refurbed - they look nice on the surface, but will quickly wear, due to the cheapness of the fixtures and fittings used, especiallly the showeroom, a shame really. The aircon was having difficulty keeping up and never seemed to get to the promised minimum setting of 19 degrees - the room was like an oven, and the noise from the road - unbearable! The newly refurbed restaurant is totally lacking in atmosphere - it serves bar meal quality food, but without the bar. Of the 5 or 6 main dishes that were on the menu 2 were not available. It took over an hour to get the 2 courses - the soup was lovely though, the lasagna not so. The breakfast service was very poor, very slow again, with poor choice from the continental section and very poorly laid out; the glasses were away from the juices and the dishes were away from the cereals - not thought through at all. I am a Platinum customer on BW - no room up-grade, no newspaper, no discount on meals, no need for me to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DCHOTELGUY01
Reviews.Content: They are putting money into this hotel. The rooms were 89Â£ (pounds). They had redone the lobby, they were doing the brick driveway, and the room I stayed in 217 looked brand new. The breakfast was included and was standard english breakfast. It was quiet. Parking is a bit tight, but at no additional charge. It is outside the city, but half the city cost or less. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cvigue
Reviews.Content: Simply, this hotel was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I have traveled world-wide for years and have stayed at many Best Western hotels with very good experiences. Thus, this review should not reflect on Best Western in general. First, the web site indicated that the motel was a 10 minute walk from the tube station. Actually, it was 30 minutes. When I arrived at the hotel they had difficulty finding my reservation. There was no restaurant within a 30 minute or more walk. The staff could not make change for me to take the bus to a restaurant or to get a candy bar and Coke from a vending machine. But they did invite me to breakfast the next morning. When I returned to the hotel the second night after sight seeing there was only one set of towels. The staff was very reluctant to deliver a second set obviously believing I was trying to steal a set. The next morning I returned for breakfast was was informed that I could not have breakfast because it wasn't included in my rate. The staff was very rude, uncooperative and very customer unfriendly. NEVER stay at this hotel !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again. Terrible FOOD!”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled1970
Reviews.Content: Rooms very nice & clean but food absolutely terrible!!! Reheated pre packed and very poor! Food cold in middle and frazzled around the edges - I was assured that it was not microwaved but I beg to differ, problems with shower drainage & bad smell of drains in corridors. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: laurapink12345
Reviews.Content: Hotel accommodation poor value for your money. 3 out of 4 lights didn't work and the sockets were worse. Reception slow as only 1 person working on it trying to deal with a coach load of German tourists and others staying there. The quilts on the bed were far too small and kept falling off. No extra blankets readily available as I would have expected for a supposedly 3 star hotel. Maybe 1 star would be more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Snagging required”
Reviews.Author: Cbr0
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a friends funeral was taking place nearby. I found this place on the internet and the pictures and reviews looked good. Unfortunately we had a few problems, the place is just about finished after a complete refurb and so looks fantastic. However we had issues like lamps and tv's not working, bathroom doors jamming shut, windows which are sealed shut and only hot air available from the aircon. Although these aren't huge problems, and are down to snagging needing done on the refurb work, I was dissapointed. The one member of staff who seemed to be doing everything while we were there was helpful enough, but he couldn't fix everything for us. All in all I was disappointed as I hadn't paid a particularly price for the hotel and had been charged Â£35 for asking for an extra 2 hours on checkout to allow us to arrive at the funeral on time. On check out we were too focussed on the funeral to go through all our gripes so I decided to email when I got home. This is where I have to say that I was mightily impressed with the managers response. The response was almost instant offering me an apology and a number of options to make up for my problems. I was very happy with how the matter was resolved and can only praise this kind of fantastic customer service. On reflection I can say that I hope all the snags with the refurb will be picked up quickly, which will mean that this hotel will be a very attractive prospect. And well done management, I know a lot of 'top end' places that could learn a few lessons from your excellent after sales service!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice boutique type room”
Reviews.Author: annemarie14_09
Reviews.Content: Dual carriage way the Hotel is on is very busy and the nearest underground is 15min walk away, but we stayed in the refurbished wing - room 211 - and it was really nice - air conditioned - shower was great - hot and some force, room was really nice though and we only paid Â£80 per night for the two of us. Pretty good price thru booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay during major building works”
Reviews.Author: JohnNord
Reviews.Content: Palm Hotel is under major rework meaning no lift, (Conceige on duty carried our cases up the stairs), no kitchen for cooking dining type meals (only for hearty English breakfast) and no onsite laundry. Fighting jetlag we slept so well in the king sized bed. The refurbished room has many power outlets, great TV with huge selection of channels, double glazing (street facing room with hardly any noise). The bathroom has a heated mirror with small pencil lights around the perimeter and a small motion sensor. It allows one to go to the bathroom at night and not need to turn on the light and noisy fan to disturb your partner. A great idea. The shower was good and the water pressure excellent. In room free internet connection (cable supplied) and free wireless in the foyer area. Really fantastic and fast. The Conceige on duty, Maria and her assistants, was fantastic and very helpful. Nothing was to much trouble. After the third day we mentioned to Maria that the cleaning lady didn't knock but just entered the room (two occasions) as well as us having damp towels for three days. Maria at the flick of her fingers fixed the problem. Thanks Maria. The hotel is on the bus stop 113 into Marble Arch so transport was no issue. The nearest tube station was 15 minutes walk, Golders Green. We are rejuvenated and look forward tro coming back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal London Hotel for Wembley Stadium and City Break”
Reviews.Author: BishopORyan
Reviews.Content: We arrived before 2pm Friday 10 September and the very pleasant receptionist said although we were early they would do best to have room ready quickly. She spoke to housekeeping and said 20 minutes (which it was). Meanwhile a charming waitress brought us coffee and biscuits in the lounge. They had paid attention to my request by phone a week earlier, and given us a back room away from the noise of the busy Hendon Way road at the front. Up at the room a bit later the chambermaid rapped on the door and gave us a bath mat, apologising it was not there already - because they had rushed to get the room ready for us quickly; again very pleasant. Very nice and clean room on top floor. Twin was ideal for my teenaged son and I. Full breakfast on Saturday and Sunday great value for GBP10 per person. Car parked right outside the front of the hotel. We walked down to Cricklewood (15 minutes) to a bank and other shops - a small but busy high street. Then walked on another 10 minutes to the tube station at Willesden Green which is on the line for Wembley Park. We were going to a rock concert that Friday night. We used a GBP30 pre-booked taxi back to the hotel from Wembley later that night. We walked 15 minutes up to Golders Green tube station Saturday morning to head into the city for a day out. I would definitely return to the Palm Hotel. I take great care when planning trips and am delighted when it works well like it did this time and Palm Hotel played an important part in that.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel...good location”
Reviews.Author: 100410b
Reviews.Content: I was on the look out for some digs near to wembley stadium and by chance came across this one, just 10 mins away by car which was cool.We had a nice room, suitable for what we wanted although the shower was not too clever (pressure was a bit low). nice comfy beds, nice food so yeah try it, we liked it.Next time im visiting wembley will most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room quality.”
Reviews.Author: hunterspudmonkey
Reviews.Content: My family and i booked this hotel as a base for the west end and london sight seeing during the summer holidays. There was a bus stop right outside the hotel which took about 20 mins to get you to the top end of oxford street ( selfridges). The hotel itself as stated in other reviews is undergoing renovation, but this had no impact on us during our stay, and as we stayed in some of the refurbished rooms the hotel is going to be all the better for the changes. The rooms are very modern,and finished to a high standard,the beds were very comfy. A nice touch is the large lcd tv on the wall that our rooms had. All in all would not hesitate to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Great Value”
Reviews.Author: darciedoo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a very reasonable hotel near to Wembley, and this was just perfect, not what I was expecting from the view from outside the hotel on a main road but inside was beautiful, very modern and clean and friendly staff. The hotel was also very quiet and very near to local amenities and bus stops. An added bonus was Ikea just down the road! I found this hotel extremely good value and would recommend this for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and the receptionist was very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: CocoSianElle
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance were looking for a cheapish hotel for the night as we were going to a gig. We came across this hotel for Â£65 which was an absolute bargain compared to the others I was given the choice of. Before arriving I phoned the hotel to ask if we could park the car, go shopping in Central London and come back to check in at 3pm. I was told this was fine and the gentleman was really polite. Upon arrival, we parked up and I went into reception to ask where we could park and the receptionist pointed us in the right direction. We arrived at 12:30 so was not expecting to check in, I explained to the receptionist my earlier phone call. I went out to get my bag to pay for the room and the receptionist said we could check in straight away! The rooms were really nicely updated, flat screen tv, nice comfy bed, lovely shower room. Also the free parking and free internet is a pretty good perk, you don't see that in many hotels these days! When we returned after midnight their was a celebration going on downstairs but you could not hear a thing. I'm sure this hotel will be up there with some of the best when the renovations are completed and the staff are really really nice - thanks for making our stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep do not book in at The Palm Hotel, Hendon”
Reviews.Author: patpem
Reviews.Content: The extremely loud music from a celebration carried on till 3.30am. We were informed by other very bleary-eyed breakfast guests that they had also suffered the noise the previous night! Complaining at Reception we were informed music should have stopped at Midnight. Reading previous reviews on this Hotel it is obvious they do not read thier customers reviews and they do not care. No wonder they want the fees paid in advance...

Reviews.Title: “Few problems but generally lovely”
Reviews.Author: hairymaclary
Reviews.Content: I was a bit put off by some bad reviews for this hotel, but since the renovation (which is still going on) it is a LOT better than the reviews say! At the moment you can tell it's being renovated - lots of scaffolding up - but our room was finished and on the other side to the building, so no problems from it at all. We didn't use the public areas but they looked nice from what we could see from Reception. Checking in and out were quick and easy and we had no problems getting help when our room key stopped working - two minutes later we were in again, thanks to the helpful and friendly staff. The room wasn't particularly big but perfectly big enough (much bigger than the last two rooms we stayed in in London, which cost more!), and very clean. The decor was nice, the tv impressive and the bathroom perfect for us, with a lovely shower and lights round the mirror. The bed was really comfy, with nice, thick pillows. There were a few problems, though. We had to go out and buy a travel hairdryer as there wasn't one provided, despite the website we booked through saying there would be. The shower door was slightly dodgy and kept falling off its runner - nothing major but enough to be irritating after a few times. The main problem was that we were in a room right next to the road, and it was fairly noisy throughout the night. I'm sure there'd be no problem with this in most rooms, but we were on just the wrong side for it, and on the ground floor. Putting up with the traffic noise was worth it for the good deal we got on the room rate, but it wasn't ideal. It was just a shame, as otherwise the room was one of the better ones I've stayed in. In terms of location, I think we chose a bad weekend to visit. The walk to and from the nearest tube (Golders Green) was do-able but not something we wanted to do twice a day, so it was nice to have a bus stop right outside. It's not a particularly long bus journey to the Jubilee line, and once there it doesn't take long to get to the centre, so the location is really quite good. What we found, unfortunately, was that in heavy traffic the bus took nearly an hour to make this journey, and giving up and walking to the tube didn't help much either as the Northern line was closed so we had to take the replacement bus service, which also took the best part of an hour. We stayed on a weekend with heavy tube closures, and I think normally this hotel has a brilliant location, but it's definitely worth checking out the planned closures before staying here because it's a nightmare if particular stations are closed! Overall this is a lovely hotel, and you shouldn't be put off by pre-renovation reviews. I'd definitely stay there again, though I might ask for a room on the other side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon023
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel a few years ago and didn't have a very good experience. WOW, how things have changed. The Palm Hotel stood out, as at first glance it looked welcoming and luxurious. The room was stunning, clean and comfortable. On top of all this, the staff were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble. It should be awarded 3/4 star at the least..Cant wait to return for more indulgence and pampering in this beautfiful underated jewel of a hotel..We will be back again and again, and I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “cheap London Hotel at good price, you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: mancity65
Reviews.Content: We only booked this Hotel because it was the cheapest & nearest to Golders Green Tube where we needed to catch a shuttle bus to a concert. The Hotel is STILL being renovated & the public lounge & lobby look quite smart; however, we were in the end of the Hotel that is yet to be renovated (I hope!), the bathroom was literally in a cupboard with double, unlockable doors; the sink hit you as you stepped in & the mildewy shower was to your left & the toilet to your right! I have never seen anything like it in all my travels! The huge TV didn't work & we only had 1 cup for 2 of us! Not all the lightng worked & the double glazing wasn't the best at keeping out the noise of the busy road below us! Furnishings like the the lampshades were shabby & the curtains were partially off the rail! But, the beds & pillows were EXTREMELY comfortable & bedding fresh & clean, it was probably one of the best night's sleep in any hotel of any standard anywhere! Breakfast was nice if you like cereal & toast, tea was rank & coffee not much better! Cooked offering consisted of fried egg in 1/2 slice fried bread with tiny rasher of bacon & similar sausage & some baked beans. All in all the Hotel was cheap (Â£49 per room per night B&B) & served a purpose, but it would be difficult to recommend it! It would be interesting to see it once the regeneration work is finally completed!

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all roll on the next time”
Reviews.Author: eleanorNotts
Reviews.Content: Took a family of four to the Palm Hotel in London and inspite of thinking we had arrived at the wrong place because of the modernization work we will definetly be using this hotel again.The rooms were spacious and the staff welcoming and very helpfull.The position of the hotel was perfect for using the public transport system for London,and free parking was provided by the hotel that is positioned just outside Londons congestion charge.

Reviews.Title: “A value stay”
Reviews.Author: Jondoe_agb
Reviews.Content: We were unlucky to stay at a time when road works were being carried out on the road directly outside the room and building works were being carried out inside the hotel! The building works did not cause any problems and seemed very well organised but being a hot weekend and needing the window open, we didn't get much sleep during the night due to the road works - not anything the hotel could foresee. The only niggle about the hotel would be not having latches on the windows and with being on the ground floor we were reluctant to leave the windows open whilst not in the rooms. Having said that the staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was fine with plenty of choice and the room we stayed in was clean and tidy if a little cosy. A short walk was required to get to the tube station but the buses run regularly from close by. The all important comment is I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel within easy reach of central London”
Reviews.Author: Rocanda
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. Good reception areas. Bus stop 50 yards from hotel. Bedrooms well furnished only letdown was the bathroom which was in dire need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, good service, noisy”
Reviews.Author: BHayes55
Reviews.Content: This is a functional but comfortable hotel on a busy dual carriageway in the Brent Cross area of north London. I was given a double room on the ground floor at the back of the hotel (the front was covered in scaffolding and polythene sheet). The room was large, comfortable and well-equipped, as well as being away from the traffic noise; scuffed here and there and some cheapish fittings, but everything worked properly and the bathroom included a 3/4 bath as well as a shower. My only real complaint was the lack of sound insulation from other rooms: TVs on until midnight, then the first people leaving at 5.30. The restaurant wasn't serving dinner, but the receptionist organised a take-away and provided plates, cutlery etc - in fact the service overall was excellent. I didn't use the parking but it seemed quite limited and I noticed a guest arguing with the receptionist because she had been blocked in by someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should/could be.”
Reviews.Author: J00ls41
Reviews.Content: We knew this hotel was being upgraded. It's covered in scaffolding and smells of paint. Most alarmingly - ALL FIRE DOORS WEDGED OPEN AND SMOKE DETECTORS IN RESTAURANT COVERED WITH FOIL. Pointed this out to reception who didnt seem concerned. Booked a refurbished room, for which you pay a bit extra. Beautiful high quality fittings and lovely ideas, but must have got cowboys to do it. Very tatty work. Blind too short for window, quilt too small for bed. No drawers in room, awkward place to plug in kettle under the desk, only 1 mirror and 1 bin - in bathroom. No biscuits, no body lotion, tissues etc. Breakfast was average. SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT, VERY FRIENDLY AND EFFICIENT. About 20 mins walk to tube at Golders Green, bit of a dodgy area at night?? Hotel is also on a very busy/noisy road, would benefit from triple glazing to the front. Hope it will all be finished off properly as could be really lovely, and was good value for what we wanted it for. Would stay again if the Fire Officer has been!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuzzLighting71
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotel as attending a weeding event at the Hotel, I must have stayed in one of the older rooms but for the price I paid I cannot complain, nice bed, good shower and superb full english breakfast. Downside was that my wrong was a bit on the noisey side, but it will not put me of if I am in North London again

Reviews.Title: “Hovel”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel whilst at a works conference and was gobsmacked. The pictures on the hotels website looked great and I thought it would of been a comfortable stay. How wrong was I. The Radiator had fallen off the wall therefore all you could see was the wallpaper hanging off. The lamp shade's had fallen off therefore lights were not working. The shower was disgusting there must of been 2inches of mould/limescale on the shower head. Please Please Please do not ever stay at this hotel. It isn't suitable for a dog to stay in. I only wish i had enough pics to show!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Best Western Palm Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 64 - 76 Hendon Way, London NW2 2NL, England
